intro: Crateva gorarema, commonly known as the Indian star apple, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a small, deciduous tree that belongs to the family Sapotaceae. The plant is characterized by its pinnate leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a round, green, fleshy berry that turns red when ripe. The botanical features of Crateva gorarema make it well-suited for cultivation in warm, humid climates.
